main event: A witness in Stamford, Connecticut reported seeing a bright shining object moving across the sky from the Northeast to the Southwest on October 17, 1962 around 6:30 PM.
interesting points: The object seemed to 'jump' as it moved, covering about 100 ground yards in 2 minutes.
The witness then saw two more objects, one coming from the Northeast and one from the Southeast, which came together with the first object to form a triangle for about 30 seconds.
The objects then broke off and went in different directions, with the first object going back the way it had come and the other two disappearing after about 15 seconds.
The witness followed the first object as it continued in a northwesterly direction until it was out of view.
The witness stated that he did not know if the information was valuable to the National Aeronautics & Space Agency, but hoped it could be of value to another government agency such as the Air Force.
sighted object: three bright shining objects in the sky
photographs: yes, the report indicates that there were photographs
